definition: to break away/to extricate/to escape/to leave the confines of
to shed/to take off/to escape/to get away from

to go out/to come out/to occur/to produce/to go beyond/to rise/to put forth/to happen/(used after a verb to indicate an outward direction or a positive result)/classifier for dramas, plays, operas etc
variant of 出[chu1] (classifier for plays or chapters of classical novels)

sentences.english: We need to stop letting our Congress and the President get away withthe crimes their getting away with.
sentences.chinese: 不要再让国会和总统逃脱出他们该受到的制裁。

sentences.english: Old pitons should not be reused once they fall out.
sentences.chinese: 老旧的岩钉一旦脱出之后，就不得重新加以使用。

sentences.english: He had won his first release from the fences of home.
sentences.chinese: 他第一次成功地脱出家庭的樊笼。

sentences.english: Objective To evaluate treatment of the bleeding and prolapse of hemorrhoids by copper ion electrochemistry.
sentences.chinese: 目的利用铜离子电化学疗法治疗痔出血及痔脱出。

sentences.english: Sometimes external hemorrhoids prolapse, or anal penetration is now outside.
sentences.chinese: 外痔有时会脱出或突现于肛管口外。

sentences.english: I slip my arm out from under his sleep head.
sentences.chinese: 我从他沈睡的头颅脱出手臂。

sentences.english: How this can be done depends on the circumstances.
sentences.chinese: 如何脱出法，须依情况而定。

sentences.english: They could have escaped right out of a Jane Austen novel.
sentences.chinese: 他们可以逃脱出一个简奥斯汀的小说。

sentences.english: The release of infectious nuclear acid from the viral coat is called uncoating.
sentences.chinese: 病毒的感染性核酸从外壳中脱出，叫做脱壳。

definition: to withdraw
to separate oneself from/to break away from/diastasis (medicine)/abscission/abjunction (botany)
to throw off/to struggle free of/Taiwan pr. [zheng1 tuo1]
shackles/to shackle/(fig.) restraint/yoke
to bind/to restrict/to tie/to commit/fetters
to roll/to turn over/to invert/to flip
to confine/to imprison/prohibition/shackles/fetters
to get away from/to withdraw/to free oneself
to break away from/to cast off (old ideas etc)/to get rid of/to break away (from)/to break out (of)/to free oneself from/to extricate oneself
to fly out
to reverse/to turn around (an undesirable situation)/(mechanics) torsion
to redouble a siege
to split/to cut open
to shift/shift/translocation/displacement/(medicine) dislocation
to make an about-turn/to reverse one's direction, policy, sequence etc/to turn things on their head
to escape/to disappear
